sentence.Network_en: The group's debut album was immediately acclaimed a hip hop classic.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个组合的首张专辑一经推出便被盛赞为嘻哈乐的经典之作。

sentence.Network_en: During the festival, we'll be showing 13 classic oldie films.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们将在电影节期间展映13部经典老片.

sentence.Network_en: "They play classic rock'n"roll,' states her boyfriend, "My dad digs them too."
sentence.Network_cn: “他们演奏经典摇滚乐，”她的男朋友说道，“我爸爸也喜欢他们。”

PerfectNetExp.abs: 但如果细究古典一词，本意可以理解为古代留传下来堪称经典的音乐作品（古代+经典），但是一般来说，古典音乐是具有规则性本质的音乐，具有平衡、明晰的特点，注重形式的美感，被认为具有持久的价值，而不仅仅是在一个特定的时代流行。这也体现于“古典”（classical）与“经典”（classic）的不同。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French classique or Latin classicus 'belonging to a class or division', later 'of the highest class', from classis (see class)

entry.def: A classic example of a thing or situation has all the features which you expect such a thing or situation to have.

example.ex: The debate in the mainstream press has been a classic example of British hypocrisy...
example.tran: 主流媒体上的辩论是英国式虚伪的典型例子。

example.ex: His first two goals were classic cases of being in the right place at the right time.
example.tran: 他的头两粒进球是站位和时机把握的典范。

entry.tran: (电影、著作、音乐)经典的，典范的，最优秀的
entry.def: A classic film, piece of writing, or piece of music is of very high quality and has become a standard against which similar things are judged.

example.tran: 经典儿童电影《哈克贝利·费恩历险记》

example.ex: ...a classic study of the American penal system.
example.tran: 对美国刑罚制度研究的典范

entry.def: A classic is a book which is well-known and considered to be of a high literary standard. You can refer to such books generally as the classics .

example.ex: As I grow older, I like to reread the classics regularly.
example.tran: 随着年龄渐长，我喜欢经常重读经典著作。

entry.def: Classic style is simple and traditional and is not affected by changes in fashion.

example.ex: Wear classic clothes which feel good and look good...
example.tran: 穿些舒适而又好看的传统服装。

example.ex: These are classic designs which will fit in well anywhere.
example.tran: 这是些百搭的古雅图案。

entry.def: A classic car is a model of car that is greatly admired because of its style, and is considered to be one of the best of its kind; used especially to talk about cars which are no longer being produced.

entry.tran: (尤指对古希腊、古罗马的语言、文学、哲学的)古典文化研究
entry.def: Classics is the study of the ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, especially their languages, literature, and philosophy.

means.word_mean: 1. a creation of the highest excellence
2. an artist who has created classic works
1. characteristic of the classical artistic and literary traditions
2. adhering to established standards and principles;

stems_affixes.word_buile: class级,阶层+ic……的→很容易知道那个阶层或类别的的→著名的→名著,经典

stems_affixes.value_cn: 古典的, 正统派的, 古典文学的
stems_affixes.word_buile: classic名著,经典+al……的→adj.古典的, 正统派的, 古典文学的
class级,阶层+ic……的→很容易知道那个阶层或类别的的→著名的→名著,经典
classify[v.分类, 分等]+ation行为,过程→classification→分类行为或分类结果→分类, 分级
class班级+mate配偶,助手;对手→n.同学
class等级,种类+ify成为……→v.分类, 分等

means.word_mean: (著作, 赛事等)最优秀的, (可作)典范的

sentences.en: The novel is regarded as one of the classic works.
sentences.cn: 这篇小说被公认为是最优秀的作品之一。

sentences.en: It is a classic case of malnutrition.
sentences.cn: 这是营养不良的典型病例。

means.word_mean: (衣服, 设计等)传统式样的, 典雅的

sentences.en: It is a classic style of Gothic buildings.
sentences.cn: 这是哥特式建筑的典型样式。

sentences.en: The football match was a classic.
sentences.cn: 那场足球比赛堪称典范。
